loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits in wholesale and some bags of sugar and flour.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio con su anterior credikiva compró un carro para distribuir los jugos, adquirió también una vitrina calentadora y hasta le alcanzó para comprar materias primas e insumos con los que aumentó su producción. Hoy su negocio tiene una mejor presentación y las ventas se incrementaron. Julio envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: Le doy gracias y que continúen con esa hermosa labor que es la de ayudar a los pequeños empresarios” En la actualidad aplicó a un credikiva mediante el cual compró una carpa para protegerse del sol y del agua lluvia, para poder extender su jornada de trabajo hasta mas tarde.
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan Julio bought a cart to distribute juice.  He also got a heated cabinet.  He even had enough to buy raw materials and supplies with which he increased his production.  Now his business has a better presentation and the sales have increased.

Julio sends the following message to his Kiva lenders.  “I thank you, and may you continue with this beautiful work of helping small business people.”

He currently applied for a Kiva loan with which he bought a canopy to protect himself from the sun and the rain.  This way he is able to extend his working day until much later.

loans.use: to buy a canopy to protect himself from the sun and the rain.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra, de 32 años de edad, es una fami-empresaria que se ha caracterizado por sacar adelante a su familia y buscar mejores oportunidades para generar ingresos y colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que por situaciones ajenas a su voluntad, el empleo ha escaseado y sólo trabaja por días. Sandra asegura que mientras pueda ella hará todo lo posible por brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y garantizarle a su hijo educación. 
“La familia, el amor y los sueños son como un cuerda de tres hilos que enlazados jamás pueden ser destruidos, por esta razón busco la manera de colaborarle a mi esposo en tiempos de necesidad por que somos uno solo” Con estas palabras Sandra manifiesta el gran amor hacia su familia.
En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa desde su casa con el fin de cuidar de su hijo de diez años de edad. Asegura que las ventas han sido su mejor aliado en tiempos de crisis y gracias a su buena atención las ventas se han aumentado, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía. Espera poder mejorar su condición económica y motar su negocio en un local cerca a su casa.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old. She is a family business woman who is getting her family ahead and seeking better opportunities to generate income and help her husband with the household expenses. Due to circumstances beyond her control, employment has grown scarce and she only works sporadically. Sandra says that as long as she can, she will do everything possible to offer her family a better quality of life and guarantee her child and education.  

“Family, love and dreams are like a three fibered rope that woven together can never be destroyed. That is why I seek a way to help my husband during times of need, because we are one". With these words, Sandra expresses the great love she has for her family.

At this time, she is selling clothes from her home so she can care for her ten year old son. She assures us that the sales have been her best ally in times of crisis and thanks to her good service, her sales have increased. That is why she is asking for a loan that she will invest in buying merchandise. She hopes to improve her financial situation and set up her business in a local close to her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Lununi Group

texts.en:
Lununi, represented by Lindison, is a group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. The group has 10 women and 2 men. Lindison is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet and sorghum. Lindison first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Lindison joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Lindison reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 6 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 10 bags per 1/2 acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a cow and send his children to school. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Lindison’s group will receive 6 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computers and tables.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: Les presento al grupo “LAS TRES MARIAS” grupo conformado por 6 mujeres empeñosas  se encuentran pasando el octavo ciclo. Rebeca es una de las integrantes del grupo. Es soltera tiene 32 años tiene dos hijos menos. Trabaja en la bodega que puso en su casa hace dos años. Su mayor deseo es tener una bodega más grande y darles una profesión a sus hijos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Rebeca es la ultima del lado izquierdo viste con polo negro y pantalón negro.
texts.en: Meet the "Las Tres Marias" ("The Three Marias") group, composed of 6 persevering women. They are in their eighth loan cycle. Rebeca is one of the members of the group. She is single, 32 years old, and has two small children. She works in the grocery store she put in her house two years ago. Her greatest dream is to have a bigger store and give her children a profession. The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan provided. Rebeca is the last one on the left, dressed in a black polo shirt and black pants.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and oil for her grocery store

loans.name: Álvaro De Jesús

texts.es:
Álvaro de 55 años de edad inició su vida como comerciante en el municipio de Santa Bárbara, Colombia a la edad de 18 años, gracias  al apoyo de su padre montó su tienda en donde se dedicó a la comercialización de productos de la canasta familiar.  Después de casarse, decidió radicarse en el municipio de Itagüí en donde reside actualmente con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Trasladó su negocio y labora diariamente de ocho de  la mañana a ocho de la noche. Gracias a su actividad ha podido garantizarles a su familia una vida digna y educación a sus  hijos.
En la actualidad desea ampliar su portafolio de productos por la alta demanda en el sector, y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con el capital para realizar dicha inversión. 
Su mayor sueño es poder convertir su tienda en un mercado autoservicio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 55 years old. He started his life as a merchant in the town of Santa Bárbara, Colombia when he was 18 years old.  Thanks to his father's support, he set up a store where he sold basic family basket products. After marrying, he decided to live in the town of Itagüí where he lives now with his wife and two children. He transferred his business and works every day from eight in the morning until eight at night. Thanks to this activity, he has been able to guarantee his family a dignified life and an education for his children.

At this time, he wants to expand his portfolio due to the high demand in the area. That is why he is asking for a loan, since he doesn't have the capital to make the investment. 
 
His biggest dream is to be able to convert his store into a self serve market and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy basic family basket products.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna (with her child) is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 months to 18 years. She describes herself to be good woman. Lorna operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a slum area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to run another beauty salon within 5 years. Lorna took a previous loan of 50,000 KES from SMEP DTM which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 34 years old and married with 2 children.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock. Mary Ann has been raising livestock for seven years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania, de 57 años de edad , está casada con Hector con quien tiene un hijo de 16 años respectivamente .Con mucho esfuerzo Melania ha logrado emprender el largo camino de “la agricultura” por está razón sale todas las mañanas a trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, alverjas, zanahorias y habas, las cuales luego lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados . Además comenta que se dedica a la ganadería; donde engorda a los animales para luego vender su carne, “siempre le va muy bien”, comenta. Ya que tiene el asesoramiento de su esposo quien trabaja como ganadero en otras estancias ganando un dinero extra. Por ello  desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción.Melania, invertirá los S/1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus hortalizas.
texts.en:
Melania is 57 years old. She is married to Hector and they have a child who is 16 years old. 

With a lot of effort Melania has successfully taken the long road of agriculture and this is why she gets up every morning to work on the fields making them productive. She grows potatoes, peas, carrots, and beans and then later takes them to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where she sells them at a wholesale price. Her crops have provided the necessary income to support her family and this is why she wants to put all her efforts into getting ahead in this business.

The thing that she likes most in her work is caring for her crops. She has thirty years experience and she thinks the most difficult thing is getting her product to Tarma, as the sacks are very heavy. 

She says also that she raises livestock, fattening the animals for later sale of the meat, and “it always goes very well,” she comments. And she has the advice of her husband who works as a farmer on other farms to earn extra money. So she is hoping to buy more land in in order to increase her production.

Melania will invest the 1500 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her vegetables.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Blanca Inés

texts.es:
Blanca de 58 años, es casada y madre de dos hijos. Su vida se ha visto marcada por la difícil situación económica, debido a que su esposo se encuentra en delicado estado de salud y ella debe solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Blanca se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer luchadora, por lo cual en medio de la dificultad siempre ha encontrado alternativas para salir adelante. Debido a que cuida de su esposo, esta mujer decidió dedicarse a la venta de huevos y engorde de pollos, lo que le permite generar ingresos, velar por la salud de su cónyuge y realizar los quehaceres del hogar.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar sus ingresos y garantizarle a su familia condiciones de vida digna. Desea poder convertirse en una microempresaria y distribuir su producto en los diferentes negocios de su localidad, por lo cual requiere incrementar su capacidad de producción y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de pollos y gallinas ponedoras.
Espera que su esposo recupere su salud y en conjunto puedan luchar por alcanzar su gran sueño: ser microempresarios.
texts.en:
Blanca is 58 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Her life has been marked by difficult financial situations, because her husband is ailing and she has to pay for the household expenses. Blanca has been described as a woman who is a fighter who throughout her difficulties has always found a way to get ahead. Since she takes care of her husband, this woman decided to sell eggs and chickens. This allows her to generate income, care for her husband's health, and do the household work.

Her biggest wish is to improve her income and guarantee her family a dignified life. She wants to be able to become a great businesswoman and distribute her products to different businesses in her community. That requires increasing her production capital and that is why she is asking for a loan to invest in buying chickens and egg laying hens.

She hopes that her husband recovers and that together they will fight to reach their biggest dream: becoming micro-business people.

loans.use: to buy chickens and egg laying hens.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad, de 55 años de edad , se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y sincera, vive desde hace 30 años en su casa propia junto a uno de sus hijos , quien siempre la ayuda en el trabajo.Todas  se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de lechuga, espinaca y alverja; los cuales después de cuidarlos y abonarlos constantemente los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y siempre suelta una broma para llevarse mejor con ellos, ya que su principal estrategia en la vida es la alegría que le pone a todo lo que realiza aunque hace poco sufrió una operación del apéndice, por lo que está en cama. Pero esta dificultad no la amilana, a contrario le inyecta fuerzas para salir adelante y seguir apoyando a su hijo con sus estudios superiores, por ello está segura que podrá ser una de las mejores agricultoras y comerciantes de la zona. Soledad, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus hortalizas ,además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, pues siempre demostró ser una persona responsable.
texts.en: Soledad, 55 years old, is a very hard-working and sincere woman. For 30 years, she has lived in her own house with one of her children, who always helps her with the work. They are all farmers, and they grow lettuce, spinach, and peas. After caring for them and fertilizing them constantly, she sells them in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. She enjoys talking with her customers and she always comes out with a joke to get along better with them, since her main strategy in life is the happiness that she brings to everything she does. However, not long ago she had an operation on her appendix, so she is in bed. But this difficulty does not daunt her. On the contrary, it gives her strength to move forward and continue supporting her son with his higher education. She is sure that due to it he will be one of the best farmers and businesspeople in the area. Soledad will use the money to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her vegetables. Also, she promises to be punctual with her loan repayments, since she has always demonstrated that she is a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Shaqro

texts.en:
Shaqro is the proud father of three sons (his elder son, Karen, is in the photo with him). Jointly with his sons, Shaqro runs a farm, which currently includes 10 cows, 35 sheep, two pigs, 20 chickens and 30 bee colonies.

Shaqro is a pensioner. The family’s main source of income is its farming business. The family works hard to earn a high income and cover the family's basic costs. In this region, there is a high unemployment rate, but a farming business helps provide the family with a stable income. 

Shaqro has applied for this loan to expand his agricultural activity. With the help of this loan, he would purchase five pigs and forage to feed them.

The loan is very important for Shaqro to earn a high income and ensure a better life for his sons.

loans.use: to buy five pigs and forage to feed them

loans.name: Dublas Bernardo

texts.es:
Dublas tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Dublas en busca de obtener ingresos, hace un año estableció un negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, pan, café harina, huevos, refrescos, lácteos, golosinas etc. El ha mantenido su familia con las ventas de su pulpería. Le va muy bien en su negocio lo tiene bien surtido y por lo tanto sus ingresos son rentables. El atiende todo el día para atender mejor a  la clientela.
Con el préstamo actual de 20000 lempiras, el va a aumentar su inventario de estos productos abasteciéndose de harina, lácteos, arroz, frijoles, y otra parte la utilizara para reparar su vehículo que le sirve como herramienta de trabajo en su negocio.
Espera crecer más y superarse para darle a su familia una vida más cómoda. Le importa mucho la educación de sus hijos y espera poder darles la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Dublas is 39 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He lives in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

A year ago Dublas, looking to earn income, established a grocery store where he sells staple goods such as beans, rice, sugar, bread, ground coffee, eggs, soft drinks, milk products, sweets, etc. He has supported his family with the sales from his grocery store. The business is going well for him. He has it well-stocked, and therefore he is making a profit. He looks after the shop all day in order to better serve his customers. 

With the current loan of 20,000 lempiras, he is going to increase his inventory of these products, stocking up on flour, milk products, rice, and beans. He will also use part of it to repair his vehicle, which he uses for his business. He hopes to grow more and to excel in order to give his family a more comfortable life. The education of his children is very important to him, and he hopes to give them the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy products such as flour, milk products, rice, and beans, and also to repair the vehicle that he uses for his business

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es:
Deyanira de 50 años de edad, es casada.  Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo debido a una difícil situación económica que padeció su núcleo familiar. Cuando su cónyuge se quedó sin empleo, esta mujer decidió auto emplearse y generar ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar. Gracias a su actividad su condición económica ha mejorado y hoy sueña en convertirse en una microempresaria y ampliar su negocio, Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de un computador que utilizará para la solicitud de sus pedidos vía internet y llevar la contabilidad de sus ventas.
Espera en un futuro próximo tener un local, en donde pueda comercializar su mercancía con el objeto de aumentar sus ventas y seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Deyanira, 50 years old, is married. For five years she has been selling products from a catalog due to a difficult financial situation suffered by her family. When her husband lost his job, this woman decided to become self-employed to earn income to support the household. Thanks to her work the financial situation has improved and now she dreams of becoming a microentrepreneur and expanding her business. 

The reason she is requesting a loan is to use the funds to buy a computer to be used for order requisitions via the Internet and to keep track of her sales.

She is hoping to have her own facility in the future where she can sell her merchandise in order to increase sales and continue growing as a microentrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with two children, who both go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has been in the charcoal-selling business for six years. She sells wholesale and retail to all categories of people.  

Sarah has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from the Micro Credit for Development and Transformation Savings and Credit Cooperative Society. She would use the loan to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Sarah's major business challenges include transportation and seasonal factors. She aspires to owning a delivery van to ease her transportation challenges and also to building her own house. She resides in a rented house, with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is married and a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Miguela successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Miguela's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of Mwangaza Group in Teso District. She is pictured with 16 One Acre Fund farmers, 9 women and 7 men. Nancy is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Nancy is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Nancy described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Nancy’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more maize and fish

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a glove-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from jeepney transportation. Milagros is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy supplies for her glove-making business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for glove-making.

loans.name: Tuvute Group

texts.en:
Tuvute is a group of 20 farmers in Teso District represented by David. The group has 11 women and 9 men. David is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of Sweet Potato, millet and sorghum. David is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for his family and use the increased profits to send his children to school.

David described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. David’s group will receive 10 acres worth of inputs on credit. 

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is applying for a new loan of PHP 10000 to purchase more used clothing to sell to customers.  Her used clothing business has been assisted and funded through NWTF, and continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara, who lives with his parents, sister and wife who support him in his agricultural enterprise, is a 30-year-old farmer from Shirak region. He keeps eight cows, four chickens and four calves, and uses the milk in cheese production.

Farming is the only source of income for Ara, and it helps him to cover his family's daily costs. He has requested this loan to buy two cows and four calves, purchases that will enable him to increase his agricultural products and earn a higher income from their sales.

This loan is very important for Ara to be able to improve his family's living conditions and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and four calves.

loans.name: Akingarakin Group

texts.en:
Milton’s group has 15 farmers and is located in Teso District. Milton is pictured on the right of the Akingarakin Group with his hand raised. Milton is pictured amongst the three men and 12 women of his group. He will receive input loans which will mean he will be capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and Sweet Potato. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Milton’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to best input prices of hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Milton thought his harvest last year was poor. He hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer he can have an excellent harvest. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and perhaps buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Milton’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Francisco Orlando

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos de 12, 8 y 5 años respectivamente. Tiene más de 11 años de dedicarse a prestar servicios en su molino de una tolva (actualmente ya cuanta con dos tolvas) producto del financiamiento que le otorgo LA FUNDACION CAMPO Y KIVA. Este se encuentra ubicado a unos 50 metros de la calle principal que conduce a una cuidad. Este servicio lo presta a las personas que viven en la comunidad y las comunidades vecinas en horarios de 4.00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. el negocio es administrado por su esposa; ya que él, también  se dedica a prestar servicio de trasporte realizando viajes a una ciudad 3 veces por semana a comprar frutas y verduras con las señoras que venden en el mercado. 

Él Programa los viajes a la cuidad, cuando las persona se lo solicitan con dos días de anticipación. La tolva que anexo al molino la compro en una comercial de la ciudad que esta a una distancia aproximadamente de 18 kilómetros  

El financiamiento solicitado anteriormente lo invirtió en la compra de una tolva más para su molino y este crédito será invertido en pagos de saldos del crédito anterior y el resto en mejoramiento de las bases del molino, cambio de madera por superficies de hierro como también en mejora de la infraestructura del local donde tiene el molino.   
 
Al comprar una tolva más podrá cubrir la demanda existente que tiene en la comunidad y los usuarios ya no tendrán que hacer filas para moler. Los planes a futuro que tiene, es poder comprar un terreno para la construcción de una vivienda; por que donde están viviendo actualmente es alquilada.
texts.en:
Francisco is 28 years old. He is married and has three children aged 5, 8, and 12, respectively. For more than 11 years he has provided services on his mill with one hopper (now he has two hoppers), a product of the financing given to him by La Fundación Campo and Kiva. This business is located 50 meters from the main road that goes to the city. He provides this service to people who live in the community and in neighboring communities between the hours of 4:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. The business is managed by his wife, since he also has a transportation service, making trips to the city 3 times per week to buy fruit and vegetables with the women who sell in the market.

He schedules the trips to the city when someone asks him two days in advance. He bought the hopper connected to the mill at a store in the city, which is approximately 18 kilometers away.

He used the previous loan to buy another hopper for his mill, and this loan will be used to make payments on the previous loan as well as to upgrade the base of the mill, replacing the wood with an iron surface, as well as to upgrade the infrastructure of the building where he has the mill.

He would be able to meet existing demand with the purchase of another hopper, and users would no longer have to wait in line for grinding. His future plan is to be able to buy a piece of land to build a house, because he rents where he lives now.

loans.use: to pay a previous debt and to use the rest to upgrade the base of his mill, replacing the wood with an iron surface as well as to upgrade the infrastructure of the building where he has his mill

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 40 years old, married with 6 children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Anabelle has a fishing business in the Philippines. Anabelle requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy paint, hardwood and other equipment.

Anabelle has been in this business for four years. In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy paint, hardwood and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Roho Moja Group

texts.en:
Joseph is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Roho Moja Group members. The 15 of them, 8 women and 7 men, are farmers in Teso District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Joseph’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to rest assured of reliable input delivery and to grow enough food for the family.

Joseph thought his harvest last year was poor. He hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer he can have an excellent harvest. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Joseph’s group will receive 7.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 49 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Josefina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other sea-food to sell in her food stall.

Josefina has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other sea-food to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. Marlyn is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 48 years old, married and has seven children, one of whom is in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 34 years old and married with three children.

Aileen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, snack foods, detergent and other groceries.

Aileen has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from a mini-bakery and a gaming station.

Aileen aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, snack foods, detergent and other groceries.

loans.name: Sokomoko Group

texts.en:
Elikana is a member of the Sokomoko Group in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is pictured with 11 other One Acre Fund farmers, seven women and four men. He is standing on the right with his hand raised. 

During the long rains in 2009, Elikana joined One Acre Fund to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer and grow enough food for his family. He is now enrolled for the 2013 long rains season and is receiving a loan to cultivate a half acre of millet and sorghum. 

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Elikana was only able to harvest three bags of maize per half acre. After joining the group, during the long rains of 2012, he was able to harvest eight bags per half acre! 

Elikana’s group members will each receive input loans for a half acre during the 2013 long rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for six acres of millet and sorghum. Elikana plans to use future profits to send his children to school and to repair his home.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to cultivate millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Kumrije

texts.en:
Kumrije wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which helped her to buy an irrigation machine. With the previous loan, she has increased the yield which helped to increase her business profit. She is very satisfied with her business. Kumrije used these profits to help her family, and she managed to improve the conditions of her family life. Kumrije plans to continue her business in the future.  

Kumrije now is requesting a second loan for the same business to build a warehouse to have a place to keep fruits. The loan will help her not to have to sell fruit with low price. Until now this is what she had to do as she had no place to keep them so she sold them at a low price. Her goal is to provide a secure life for her family. 

Kumrije wants to thank again Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: To build a warehouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil and cereals.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has one school-going child. He earns an income from from renting hand carts, which are used to transport and sell water to his neighbors. He has been operating this business for half a year. Apart from this business, he is also employed as a chef. 

Patrick learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to better his business operations. The main challenge he faces is the scarcity of water. 

Patrick is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy more hand carts. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the business, open other branches and pay for school fees.

loans.use: To buy more hand carts.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is a 26-year-old from Gaza. He has owned a food stall since 2010.

He has asked Ryada, a microfinance provider and partner of CHF International, for this youth loan to buy some goods and a small automobile.

He hopes this loan will help him decrease his transportation costs and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy some goods and a small automobile.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase vehicle tires and carry out body work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of groceries including maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Aida Idalisis

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer de 44 años de edad casada, luchadora, emprendedora y madre de 3 hijos de los cuales el mayor con 15 años de edad, el segundo con 13 años de edad el menor de 4 años los cuales viven y dependen de ella y su esposo los cuales juntos en familia trabajan la agricultura en la siembra y cultivo de café al salir de sus actividades escolares. Ella tiene un grado de educación superior siendo ella Técnico Universitario en intervención social la cual ejerce como maestra de educación primaria. Ella aprendió la actividad de sus padres a muy temprana edad ya que fueron ellos los que le enseñaron el cultivo y siembra de café mismos que se han dedicado desde toda una vida a este rubro. en compañía de su esposo cultivan café desde hace mas de 7 años la cual esta ubicada a 20 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en vehículo. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en la zona donde ella habita con los intermediarios, vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y bombas de fumigación para su cultivo de café ya que esta propenso a poderse infectar con plagas y con enfermedades como la roya de no darse el mantenimiento apropiado.

Su sueño poder ampliar sus cultivos para obtener mejores ganancias de esa forma darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos permitiendo apoyarles en sus estudios y que ellos puedan autorrealizarce cursando una carrera universitaria la cual les ayude a implementar tecnología para sus cultivos ya que este es el patrimonio que ellos heredaran.
texts.en:
Aida is a married 44-year-old woman. She is a fighter, entrepreneurial, and mother to 3 children, the oldest of whom is 15 years old. The second is 13 years old and the youngest is 4. They live with and depend on her and her husband. As a family, they work in farming and grow coffee when they are done with their school activities. She has a postsecondary education and has a University Technician degree (a one and a half to three year program) in social intervention, which she uses as a primary school teacher. She learned farming from her parents at a very young age, since they were the ones who taught her how to grow coffee and had dedicated their whole lives to it. She and her husband have been growing coffee for more than 7 years. The crop is located 20 minutes from her house, and they travel there by car. Her product is sold in the area where she lives to middlemen, neighbors, family members, and friends.

Currently she is asking for help to buy fertilizer, manure, and crop sprayer pumps for her coffee crop, since it tends to become infested with insects and affected by diseases such as coffee rust if not given the appropriate maintenance.

Her dream is to be able to increase her crops in order to earn more, thus giving her children a better future and allowing her to support them in their studies. She also dreams that they will be able to reach their potential by attending college, which will help them to implement technology for their crops, since this is the asset they will inherit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, and crop sprayer pumps for her coffee crop

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a farming business. She keeps poultry. Besides this, she also deals in the transport business.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is change in business seasons and climate. 

Juliet is applying for a loan of 4,550 Kenya shillings to buy a modern charcoal stove. She believes the family will enjoy an improved health status owing to the fact that the stove does not emit smoke.

loans.use: To buy a modern charcoal stove.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a food stall. This business has been running for ten years. Besides this, she also runs owns rental houses. She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is lack of adequate capital. 

Mariamu is applying for a loan of 4,550 Kenya shillings to buy a modern charcoal stove. She believes the family will enjoy an improved health status owing to the fact that the stove does not emit smoke.

She aspires to own a cafe.

loans.use: To buy a modern charcoal stove.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es:
Jeannette, de 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos de 8 y 3 años respectivamente, vive en casa de sus suegros en compañía de sus hijos y su esposo.Jeannette se dedica a la venta de zapatos, hace sus pedidos de otra ciudad, le envían y se encarga de visitar a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares en busca de nuevos clientes. Lleva haciendo éste trabajo por 03 años y trabaja sola ya que no es necesaria otra persona para el tipo de trabajo que desempeña.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite estar a lado de sus hijos el tiempo necesario para cuidarlos y educarlos, cuando cumple su función laboral realiza buenas ventas debido a que sus clientes confían en los productos que ofrece. Le gustaría ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda grande en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.Este es el crédito número 04 con Kiva, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados , a su vez  se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 soles, comprará más zapatos para seguir con sus ventas ya que se avecina la temporada de invierno .
texts.en:
Jeannette is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 8 and 3 respectively. She lives in her in-laws' house with her children and husband, and she sells shoes, ordering and receiving them from another city. Jeannette visits neighbors, friends, and acquaintances in search of new clients. She has been doing this work for 3 years and she works alone, since another person is not necessary for the work she does.

What Jeannette likes most about her work is that it allows her to be at the side of her children when necessary, to care for and educate them. When she fulfills her labor function, she achieves good sales, since her customers have confidence in the products she offers. Jeannette would like to expand her business and have a large store where she could offer her products in greater comfort for her customers.

This is Jeannette's 4th loan with Kiva. And that's why she is so grateful to all the people who have made her loans possible and helped her work to continue with better results. For her part, she promises to comply punctually with her payments. With the solicited sum of 2,500 sols, Jeannette will purchase more shoes to continue with her sales, now that the winter season is approaching.

loans.use: buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a retail shop. This business has been running for five years. Besides this, Margret is also a water vendor, selling both fresh and bore hole water. Margret learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations.  

Margret is applying for a loan of 9,100 Kenya shillings to buy modern charcoal stoves. She believes the family will enjoy an improved health status owing to the fact that the stove does not emit smoke.

loans.use: To buy modern charcoal stoves.

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjollca is an Egyptian widow woman and has two grown-up children. She adores her grandchildren who are in the photograph with her. "This is where I spent my whole time cooking and bathing them and looking after them" Vjollca said. “ They are my life,” she continued kissing them.

They live in a main city in the southern Albania within their community, where she sells used items like the majority of people in her neighborhood. 

The reason Vjollca is requesting this loan is to repair her run down home. Her previous loans have been paid back on time and she has been a good client of VisionFund Albania for long time.

loans.use: To repair their rundown family home.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and keeps poultry. This business has been running for fourteen years. Besides this, Amina, a mother of two, also sells fresh juices. She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Amina's main challenge is lack of adequate capital. 

Amina is applying for a loan of 4,550 Kenya shillings to buy a modern charcoal stove. She believes the family will enjoy an improved health status owing to the fact that the stove does not emit smoke and will also save on energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a modern charcoal stove.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a tailoring shop. This business has been running for ten years. Besides this, she also sells cosmetics. She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is lack of adequate capital. 

Mariam is applying for a loan of 4,550 Kenya shillings to buy a modern charcoal stove. She believes the family will enjoy an improved health status owing to the fact that the stove does not emit smoke and will reduce their energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a modern charcoal stove.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 42 years old and married with two children who are currently going to school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elma has a business buying and selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell like onions garlic, spring onions, ginger, etc..

Elma has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell like onions garlic, spring onions and ginger.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. Flordeliza is a widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Flordeliza requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for many years now.  

In the future, Flordeliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 58 years old, married and has seven children. 

Florentina is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Florentina requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Florentina has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florentina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a business buying and selling mangoes in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of mangoes to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Luz Adriana María

texts.es:
Luz Adriana de 36 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora que está convencida que con disciplina y esfuerzo es posible llegar a donde se desea. Cuenta que aunque el dinero nunca ha sido su mayor aliado, siempre se encuentra en búsqueda de oportunidades que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones económicas y ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Desde hace un mes,  tomó la decisión de  montar su propio negocio en conjunto con su esposo, por lo cual abrieron una papelería con el propósito de satisfacer la necesidad carente en su localidad y generar recursos para los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus dos hijos menores de edad. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de un equipo de cómputo, mueble y artículos de papelería. Espera que su nuevo proyecto de empresa alcance el punto de equilibrio y le brinde una estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Adriana, 36 years old, is a fighter who is convinced that with discipline and effort it is possible to get where you want to go. She says that although money has never been her greatest ally, she is always looking for opportunities that will allow her to improve her financial situation and offer her family a better quality of life. 

A month ago, she made the decision to start her own business with her husband, so they opened a stationery store with the goal of satisfying an unmet need in her area and generating resources for household expenses and the education of their two minor children. Today she is asking for a loan that will go toward purchasing computer equipment, furniture, and stationery items. She hopes that her new business project will reach the break-even point and provide economic stability to her family.

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment, furniture, and stationery products

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo de 65 años de edad , esta casado y tiene 2 hijos mayores quienes viven fuera de la ciudad , actualmente reside solo con su esposa en una vivienda construida a base de adobe.Bernardo se dedica a la compra y venta de diversos productos de su zona.Inicialmente se desempeñaba como un gran productor de cacao y café orgánico en su localidad siendo este su principal sustento familiar ,posteriormente y con el paso de los años optó por dejar de lado su tradicional actividad y poner sus parcelas en alquiler para dedicarse integralmente a la compra y venta de productos comerciales en su localidad tales como el cacao, café, achiote, palillo, barbasco, entre otros. Al ser un vendedor nuevo trata siempre de buscar un precio considerable a los productos que comercializa puesto que el también fue productor y se siente muy identificado con dicha labor.
En los  próximos meses es la temporada de cosecha cacaotera siendo una buena oportunidad de negocio para comerciantes como el y por consiguiente es necesario contar con capital para el normal desempeño de su labor.Siendo este su primer préstamo con Kiva, se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo .Requiere para esta oportunidad contar con S/.4,000 nuevos soles para destinarlo como capital en la compra de cacao orgánico ya que se acerca su temporada de cosecha.
texts.en:
Bernardo, age 65, is married and has two grown children who live outside of the city.  He currently lives only with his wife in an adobe house.

Bernardo buys and sells diverse products in his area.  Initially he worked as a big producer of cacao and organic coffee in his area, as this was the family’s main support.  Later, with the passage of the years, he chose to leave his traditional business activity to one side and to rent out his parcels of land.

He did this in order to devote himself completely to buying and selling products in his area.  He buys and sells products like cacao, coffee, annatto, turmeric, and wild yams, among others.  Upon seeing a new seller, he always tries to look for a considerable price for the products given that he, too, was a producer.  He identifies with that work a great deal.

The season for the cacao harvest is in the coming months, and this is a good business opportunity for merchants like him.  He therefore needs to have the capital for the normal performance of his work.  This is his first Kiva loan, and he is very grateful for the financial support he gets in order to continue with his work. 

He now needs 4,000 soles to buy organic cacao because the harvest time is nearing.

loans.use: to buy organic cacao.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 39-year-old widow with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a cocoa farmer but also runs a retail shop in order to earn money to meet her family's daily expenses since cocoa is seasonal. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation affect her business plans, but her dream is to expand her cocoa plantation and own a wholesale shop.

Rhoda intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy business stock.

loans.name: Salvi

texts.en:
Salvi works hard to support her family. Salvi is married and has a business buying and selling footwear and ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Salvi requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Salvi has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business buying and selling footwear and ready-to-wear.  

In the future, Salvi would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jennipher

texts.en:
Jennipher works hard to support her family. Jennipher is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Jennipher requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Jennipher has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income. 

In the future, Jennipher would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Magdalena works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Magdalena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her business.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Amalia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, biscuits, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, biscuits and soft drinks.

loans.name: María Yaneth

texts.es:
María Yaneth de 44 años, es madre soltera de un hijo menor de edad, el cual es ha convertido en la razón más importante para salir adelante a fin de brindarle un mejor futuro y mayores oportunidades educativas.
Laboró como empleada por más ocho años en la comercialización de legumbre en diferentes negocios de su localidad, y desde hace siete meses, montó su propia legumbrería, con los ahorros generados durante años de trabajo.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de legumbre con el propósito de ampliar la variedad de productos y mejorar las ventas.
Su mayor sueño es tener un local propio para reducir el costo del arriendo y aumentar sus utilidades.
Espera que con su nuevo negocio pueda brindarle a su hijo la oportunidad de acceder a educación universitaria.
texts.en:
María Yaneth, 44 years old, is a single mother of a minor child, who has become the most important reason to move ahead in order to give him a better future and better educational opportunities.

She worked as an employee for more than eight years selling vegetables in different businesses in her area. Seven months ago, she started her own vegetable shop with the savings generated from years of work.

Currently she is asking for a loan that she will use to buy vegetables with the goal of expanding the variety of products and improving sales.

Her greatest dream is to have her own building in order to reduce the cost of renting and increase her profits.

She hopes that with her new business she can give her son the opportunity to access a university education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Pilidasi

texts.en:
Pilidasi is a 53-year-old widow living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a food vendor and works eleven hours a day. She gets additional income from cocoa farming. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital affect the business.

Her personal plans are: educating her children up to the university level and building a permanent house for residence, since they now live in a mud-wattled house. Her business plan is to own a food store that can supply her customers in a way that is sustainable all year round. 

Pilidasi intends to use the loan to buy building materials such as sand and bricks for construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand and bricks for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Kasokero Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Julius is a 39-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He runs a retail shop which has been in operation for a period of two years. He is also involved in agriculture, from which he earns extra income. He would like to complete his commercial house which he started but failed to finish due to inadequate capital.

Julius is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other's access to a loan. Julius intends to use the loan to buy water, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy water, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso, de 56 años de edad , es soltero y vive en una casa alquilada junto a su madre Manuela de 95 años,a quien cuida desde hace 4 años. Narciso se dedica a la cerrajería y su negocio es muy concurrido ya que no hay muchos negocios de este tipo en su localidad , su trabajo empieza muy temprano porque debe de atender a sus clientes, quienes conociendo la buena calidad de sus trabajos, no dudan en recomendarlo a otras personas. Según afirma lo que le genera mayor rentabilidad es la estufa que vende a S/. 500 nuevos soles cada una. Hay momentos en los que le llega mucho trabajo, y para entregar sin demora contrata a personas que le ayudan en su labor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ayudar a sus clientes , quienes siempre pierden sus llaves, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que esperar clientes todo el día en su tienda. En adelante, espera seguir trabajando con las mismas fuerzas, con el único fin de sobresalir en la vida.
Narciso, invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de insumos para fabricar sus puertas tales como acero ,fierro , metales , entre otros .
texts.en:
Narciso, 56 years old, is single and lives in a rented house with his mother Manuela, 95 years old, for whom he has been caring for 4 years. Narciso is a locksmith, and his business is very busy since there are not many businesses of this type in his area. His work starts very early, because he has to wait on his customers, who, knowing the good quality of his work, do not hesitate to recommend him to other people. He says that stoves are the most profitable for him. He sells them for 500 nuevos soles each. There are moments when he has a lot of work, and in order to deliver on time he contracts with people who help him with his work. What he likes most about his work is helping his customers, who always lose their keys. He has been doing this work for 20 years, and he thinks the most difficult thing is having to wait for customers all day in his shop. In the future, he hopes to continue working with the same effort, with the single goal of moving ahead in life.

Narciso will use the 2000 nuevos soles to buy supplies to make his doors such as steel, iron, and metal, among other items.

loans.use: to buy steel and iron, among other items

loans.name: Kahondo Tukundane Group

texts.en: Arthur is a member of  the above mentioned group where each member vouches for the others in accessing loans. He is a hardworking married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is running a drug shop along side farming to earn a living. He is facing a challenge of limited capital to buy stock, however, he has a vision of acquiring a pharmacy and venturing into modern farming activities. Arthur intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 55 años de edad , esta casado con Albina , con quien tiene 3 hijos , actualmente posee una vivienda construida a base de madera en donde comparte sus vivencias familiares. Alejandp se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico pero inicialmente se desempeñaba como trabajador del lugar pero gracias a su trabajo y sus ahorros han logrado adquirir un terreno para dedicarlo íntegramente al producto con mejor sustento económico en la región.
Así es como desde hace 10 años viene desempeñándose con el apoyo de trabajadores quienes trabajan en las diversas tareas colectivas y forzosas , no obstante sus parcelas se encuentran algo distanciadas de la ciudad lo cual dificulta el de traslado de los granos de cacao que extrae.
Se encuentra en medio de su campaña productiva puesto que es necesario no descuidar el constante mantenimiento que brinda requiere contar con capital de trabajo . Tiene como objetivo a largo plazo comprarse un vehiculo con el cual pueda transportar su mercadería.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, motivo por el cual muestra su agradecimiento comprometiéndose a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Alejandro desea contar con S/.3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y proceder con el contrato de trabajadores del lugar para el deshierbo de sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 55 years old, married to Albina, and has three children. He owns a home constructed of wood which he shares with his family.

Alejandro works growing organic cocoa but initially worked as a field laborer but thanks to his work and savings has been buying land to use entirely for the product offering the best economic livelihood in the region. This is why for ten years he has been working with the support of laborers who work doing various collective and indispensable tasks, despite his plot being located some distance from the city which makes it difficult to transport the extracted cocoa beans.

He is halfway through the harvest season so it is necessary not to neglect constant maintenance which requires working capital. He has a long-term goal of buying a vehicle with which to transport his merchandise. This is his first Kiva loan, and he shows his thankfulness by committing to making his payments on time.

Alejandro wants to use the 3,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer and to proceed contracting workers for the weeding of his fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Abdul. He is married and has two children, ages four and seven, both in school. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to be fostered.

In 2007, Abdul established his jeans, crepes, shoes, shirts, sandals and mobile phones retail business. He began his business because he was unable to complete his secondary school education because of poverty and the civil war that was in the country. He engaged himself in a cobbler job and the money he accumulated was used to start a foodstuff business instead of going back to school.

Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, Abdul earns about 1,082,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy jeans, polos, Lacoste merchandise and crepes.

In the future, Abdul plans to educate his children and send them abroad for further studies, buy a car and open a shop. This loan will help to increase sales and customers. Inadequate capital is his major challenge. He is a hardworking and honest business man. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy jeans, polos, Lacoste merchandise and crepes.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita, 45 years old, is a married woman. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with four children. She is earning a living from her transport business which has been in existence for almost five years now; she earns 4,000 PHP a month.

To improve her business, Pacita is borrowing the amount of 5,000 PHP to obtain accessories and tires from GDMPC micro-credit, which she joined in 2008. She is hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of four children, Heang is aged 44, living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district in Cambodia. Out of her four children, she still has two dependent children to take care of and they are still in school.

To support her big family, Heang grows pineapple as a primary source of income for the family and she has been in this business for ten years. Her current business now earns her about 25,000 KHR per day and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

Heang is in her first cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her pineapple. She hopes this loan will enable her increase her family’s income to make better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her pineapple.

loans.name: Angie Jimena

texts.es: Esta es la historia de Angie ella dice que su historia no es muy diferente a las demas su familia se conforma por seis personas su madre que es la que los cuida y ayuda con todo lo que necesitan y que las educa para que sean personas de bien, su padre trabaja luchando para que nunca les falte nada y sus tres hermanos menores los cuales la hacen reir y llorar, ella termino sus estudios en el 2012 de bachillerato hace cinco años llegaron a la ciudad fue muy dificil porque tuvieron que dejar diferentes amistades en busca de nuevas oportunidades y fue alli donde encontro que en Campoalto podia hacer realidad sus sueños de ser Auxiliar de enfermeria porque le gusta ayudar a las personas que mas lo necesitan  ella quiere ser tambien ejemplo para muchas niñas que sus padres se sientan tambien orgullosos de ella ya que es la unica mujer que ellos tienen y la idea es que luego de que termine sus estudios en Campoalto que ella pueda seguir estudiando y se vincule laboralmente en un buen hospital donde para que tenga recursos y apoyar a sus hermanitos para que ellos tambien puedan estudiar
texts.en:
This is the story of Angie, which she says is not much different from that of others. Her family is composed of six people. Her mother takes care of everyone and helps with everything they need and educates them so that they can become good people. Her dad works fighting to make sure they never want for anything. Her three younger brothers make her laugh and cry. 

Angie finished high school in 2012. Five years ago they arrived in this city in search of new opportunities. It was very difficult because they had to leave behind many friends. It was here that she found out that in CampoAlto she could realize her dreams of becoming a nurse aid. It is her dream because she likes to help people that need it most. She also wants to be an example for many little girls so that her parents feel proud of her since she is their only daughter. Her plan is that later, after finishing her studies in CampoAlto, she can continue studying and be hired by a good hospital. This would give her resources that she wants to use to support her younger brothers so that they can also study.

loans.use: continue with her first semester of nursing assistant school.

loans.name: Mirian Arely

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 38 años de edad, luchadora, emprendedora que de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de los cuales la mayor trabaja en una ferretería y los tres menores estudian en primaria en diferentes grados los cuales al salir de sus actividades escolares ayudan a sus padres con algunas actividades en el cultivo de maíz como ser la limpia, abono, etc. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que sus padres no la pudieron apoyar por falta de recursos económicos pero le enseñaron a trabajar la agricultura desde muy temprana edad a los cuales considera un ejemplo para su familia de dedicación, esfuerzo y desempeño. Ella trabaja la agricultura en compañía de su esposo hace 12 años en lo que es la siembra y cultivo de maíz y que ademas de esa actividad también se dedican a la cría y venta de cerdos y el producto de granos básicos (maíz) que es distribuido en bodegas, pulperia y demás negocios para su venta. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 3 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de maíz y poderlo cultivar para su venta ya que es uno de los medios a parte de la venta de cerdos que genera ingresos para su familia y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la canasta básica y otros como los estudios de sus hijos y la vestimenta.

Su meta y estrategia es poder cultivar un poco mas de maíz para poder mejorar sus ventas mediante el apoyo que hoy solicita ya que necesita comprar semilla de maíz y lo que su producto hoy le genera no es suficiente ya que esta semilla de manera certificada es cara. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados universitaria mente con una carrera que ellos puedan sacar provecho y que ademas de eso aprovechen que hoy por hoy tiene fuerzas para sacarlos adelante y ser mejores cada día.
texts.en:
Mirian is a 38 year old woman, a go-getter, an entrepreneur who has four children from her marriage. The oldest works in a hardware store and the three younger ones are studying at primary school in different grades and help their parents after school with some farming activities such as cleaning corn, fertilizing, etc. She did not receive an education because her parents could not support her due to the lack of financial resources but she was taught to work in agriculture from an early age which she considers an example of family dedication, strength and performance. 

She has been working in agriculture alongside her husband for 12 years in the planting and cultivation of corn and besides that activity she also works raising and selling pigs and in basic grains (corn) that is distributed for sale in warehouses, grocery stores and other businesses. Her crops are located three miles from her home which she walks daily. 

Today she is is asking for help to buy corn in order to cultivate it to sell as it is one of the ways other than selling pigs that generates income for the family and to be able to help her husband with the basic household expenses and some for school fees and clothing for her children.

Her goal and strategy is to grow a little more corn in order to improve sales. She is asking for help because she needs to buy corn seed as her product now does not generate enough because certified corn seed is expensive.

Her dream is to see her children graduate from university with a career so they can reap a benefit and also that they can make use of it day by day having the strength to get ahead and be better each day.

loans.use: to buy corn to cultivate for sale

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam, de 36 años de edad , esta casada con Omar y tiene 2 hijos  ,con quienes vive en la casa de material rustico que compró hace 6 años. Desde las primeras horas del día hasta el último rayo de sol, Miriam trabaja sin descanso en el cultivo de sus sembríos de espinaca, alverja, lechuga y demás hortalizas, asimismo varia su siembra con la siembra de papa, ya que el terreno es propicio para su crecimiento. Sus terrenos son propios por lo que obtiene mayores ingresos en la venta de sus alimentos en la ciudad, “hay días en las que vendo en mi hogar”, afirma. Ahora ella desea mejorar en sus cultivos e invertir en mayor producción de alimentos.Este es el tercer crédito con Kivay espera recibir el apoyo financiero necesario para cumplir con sus objetivos , además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas.
Miriam, invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus cultivos de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Miriam, 36 years old, is married to Omar and has two children, with whom she lives in a home constructed of rustic materials that she bought six years ago.

 From the early hours of the day until the last ray of sunlight, Miriam works tirelessly in the cultivation of her spinach, pea, lettuce, and other vegetable crops. Additionally, she varies her planting with the sowing of potatoes since the land is suitable for its growth. Her land is her own, so she receives a higher income from the sale of her food in the city. “There are days when I sell from my home,” she affirms. 

Now, she wants to improve her crops and invest in a greater production of food. This is her third loan from Kiva, and she hopes to receive the financial support necessary to complete her objectives. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her payments. Miriam will invest the .2000 Soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her vegetable crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Yulver

texts.es: Yulver, de 38 años de edad se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Roselin de 30 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes quiere mucho. Los extensos Yulver posee grandes terrenos agrícolas los cuales son el fruto de una vida de arduo trabajo y esfuerzo, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de buena calidad le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Entre sus principales sembríos se encuentran la alverja, espinaca y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas , lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa y alverja, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. Ahora está pensando sembrar espinaca y gladiolo después de su cosecha de flores para esta festividad de fiestas patrias. Es por eso que espera comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda hacer más fácil el traslado de sus productos.Éste es el sexto crédito con KIVA, donde espera el apoyo financiero necesario para cumplir con sus objetivos ,además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas.Yulver, invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus hortalizas.
texts.en: Yulver, age 38, is known for being a very straightforward and hard-working man. He lives in a rented house together with his wife, Roselin, age 30, and his two dear children, whom he loves very much. Yulver owns extensive agricultural lands, which are the fruit of a life of hard work and effort. His products are in great demand at the wholesale market of Tarma, and his reputation for harvesting high-quality crops helps him sell his products for very good prices. Among his main crops are peas, spinach and gladiolus flowers. What he likes most about his work is protecting his crops from pests. He has done this work for 24 years, and he thinks the most difficult part is transporting sacks of potatoes and peas, since they are very heavy and make him very tired. Now he is thinking about planting spinach and gladiolus after his flower harvest for the patriotic festivals. For this reason, he hopes to buy a car, which will make it easier for him to transport his products. This is his sixth loan with KIVA, and he hopes for the financial support he needs to reach his objectives, and he also promises to be punctual with his payments. Yulver will invest the 2000 soles in buying organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Lesly Pilar

texts.es:
Lesly es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, Lesly no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
