Genelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business like nipa leaves and bamboo.

loans.name: Nonima

texts.en:
Nonima is 60 years old, married and has nine children. 

Nonima is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nonima has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Nonima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena de 36 años de edad , esta casada con Marcelino , con quien tiene 3 hijos y juntos residen en una vivienda construida a base de Material noble .Magdalena tiene una tienda de comestibles desde hace 3 años en un ambiente de su domicilio recién culminado. Teniendo como apoyo principal a sus tres menores hijos, viene desempeñándose con bastante motivación ya que ha notado que su negocio tiene tendencia a crecer de tal manera que planea ampliarlo lo mas pronto posible. Considera que uno de los factores que ayudan al culminar el día con buenas ganancias es el trato y confianza que ella brinda a sus clientes, pues gracias a ello a logrado hacerse muy conocida y a la vez querida en su localidad.Dentro de los productos mas consumidos en su negocio están las conservas y menestras, adicionando a ello los productos de uso diario como el arroz, azúcar, huevos, etc. Este es su Primer préstamo  con Kiva motivo por el cual se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado,razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con los S/.4,000  soles comprará más productos comestibles tales como arroz , azucar , conservas enlatadas , entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 36, is married to Marcelino, with whom she has three children. They live together in a home made of good-quality materials. 

For three years, Magdalena has had a grocery store in a recently finished part of her home. With the support of her three young children, she has been working with plenty of motivation, because she has noticed that her business has been growing and she plans to expand it as soon as possible. 

She believes that one of the factors which helps her to finish the day with a good profit is the friendly treatment and confidence that she extends to her clients. Thanks to this, she has managed to make herself very well-known and beloved in her town. Among the most popular products in her business are canned goods and vegetable stew, as well as daily goods such as rice, sugar, eggs, etc. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, so she is very happy to have been offered this financial support and she is committed to paying her fees on time. With the amount of 4,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy more goods such as rice, sugar, and canned goods, among other products.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.name: Sunnary's Group

texts.en:
Sunnary is a 61-year-old resident from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is widowed and has four children. She earns an income for her family's sake. She has farmed rice for 40 years. She is able to earn about 70,000 KHR per day. 

Sunnary has had one previous loan with VisionFund and has completely repaid the loan. The past loan has helped her to manage her business well and maintain a good standard of living for her family. She has now formed a group of three to request a new loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds for her farm. She hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy farm so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 28 years old and married with two children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He owns and operates a fish vending business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over five years and earn 8,000 PHP every month. He has been with GDMPC since 2010. And now he he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. He hopes and dreams to have a better future and improve his living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran el grupo llamado san jose, quienes se encuentran en su ciclo número 11 gracias al trabajo que vienen haciendo y han demostrado gran unión y ganas de salir adelante. Esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que muestra que 3 de las miembros están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza.
Una de las miembros es Venancia, quien esta en el nivel dos de eliminación de pobreza, ella cuenta que se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa, mercería, también se debe destacar el trabajo esfuerzo que ella hace por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Productos para su negocio, como ser arroz, azúcar, productos a granel, ya que son los que más venta tiene, ya que quiere poder seguir con sus ventas y crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
Seventeen women make up the group called "San Jose," which is in its 11th loan cycle, thanks to the work they continue to do, and to the fact that they have demonstrated great unity and a great desire to get ahead. The poverty elimination survey is being carried out, and it shows that three of the members are below the poverty line. 

One of the members is Venancia, who is at level two on the poverty elimination scale. She reports that she works as a merchant, since she has a neighborhood grocery store and a shop selling sewing supplies. The work and effort she makes to get ahead and help her family through her work are noteworthy. 

She is requesting this loan to buy products for her business, such as rice, sugar and bulk goods, which are her best-selling products. She wants to be able to continue with her sales and grow with her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bulk goods, etc.

loans.name: Lester Jeovani

texts.es:
Lester es originario de la Ciudad de Somotillo, Soltero, responsable, trabajador, de buenas costumbres, social.

 Se desempeña como taxista en la Ciudad de Somotillo donde se lleva muy bien con sus clientes. 

Actualmente se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un préstamo, para completar la compra de otro vehículo y de esta manera brindar un mejor su servicio a sus clientes de igual manera incrementar su capital económico.
texts.en:
Lester is originally from the city of Somotillo. He is single, responsible, hardworking, well-mannered, and social. Lester works as a taxi driver in the city of Somotillo and is doing very well with his customers.

He approached CEPRODEL to request a loan so that he could complete the purchase of another vehicle. This would allow him to provide better service to his customers and increase his financial capital at the same time.

loans.use: to complete the purchase of another taxi.

loans.name: Carolina Gabriela

texts.es:
Carolina es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Carolina no ha podido culminar sus estudios como Diseñadora Grafica, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Causa Rellena para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carolina trabaja como mesera en una pollería de su ciudad, ella brinda atención al público y puede trabajar por un aproximado de 10 horas, Carolina cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y honradez.
Carolina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cama y un colchón, los cuales le servirán de mucho, ya que actualmente ella y su pequeño hermano comparten la misma cama, de esta manera ella desea brindar mejorar en algo las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, así pues Carolina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder culminar sus estudios profesionales y así junto a su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carolina is a 19 year old young woman.  She lives with her parents and her siblings in the city of Nazca.  She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She has a great desire to improve herself.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work to help her parents, Carolina has not been able to complete her studies as a graphic designer.

In her free time she likes to watch television.  Sometimes she makes the delicious ‘Causa Rellena’ [layered potato dish that's made with yellow potatoes and either chicken or tuna salad] to share with her family. 

On her own initiative and with great determination and dedication, Carolina works as a waitress in a poultry shop in her city.  She waits on the public, and she is able to work for approximately ten hours.  Carolina believes that it is going well for her because of her sense of responsibility and integrity.

Carolina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to her she will be able to buy a bed and a mattress.  These will be very useful because she and her little brother now share the same bed.  This way she wishes to somewhat improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Carolina will continue working and putting forth great effort in order to fulfill her big dream of being able to complete her professional studies,  This way she wishes to get ahead together with her family.

loans.use: to buy a bed and a mattress.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil, ella tiene 26 años de edad. Ella empezó vendiendo cosméticos, luego les ofrecía ropa a sus clientes, como le hacían bastantes pedidos y le fue bien,  y desde ahí se ha mantenido vendiendo la ropa, las siguió vendiendo, ella vende ropa para: damas, caballeros, y niños. Y con este negocio a podido sustentarse.

Ella realiza la venta de la ropa sola, desde las 10:00 de la mañana hasta la 20:00 de la noche. Tiene una dificultad en su trabajo, es su enfermedad ya que cuando recae tiene que permanecer en cama, y en esos días no puede trabajar ya que ella es pvvs (paciente viviendo con VHI SIDA.Ella no tiene esposo, ni tampoco tiene hijos.

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar ropa de niño, de mujeres, de hombres, para la venta de su negocio. Las metas o sueños  de ella para el futuro son, de seguir junto a su familia, disfrutar junto a ellos lo bello de la vida, desea tener un local en el cual pueda vender su ropa con más comodidad, poder dar empleo a personas con la misma situación que ella.
texts.en:
This client is 26 years old and lives in Guayaquil. She started out selling cosmetics, but later began offering clothes to her customers. They placed a good number of orders with her, so she did very well. She continues to sell clothes for women, men, and children and is able to maintain her business.

The borrower sells clothes by herself from 10:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. She experiences difficulty with her work, especially when her illness forces her to remain in bed. She is not able to work some days because she is a patient living with HIV. The borrower does not have a husband or any children.

With this loan, the borrower will buy clothing for children, women, and men that she can sell in her business. Her dreams and goals for the future are to continue being with her family, to enjoy the beauty of life with them, to own a shop where she can sell clothes more comfortably, and to provide jobs to people who are in a similar situation.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Shirley requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Densmaa is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger (traditional Mongolian housing) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Baatarhuu, works at a local state-owned company. Her daughter, Bat-Erdene, age 25, graduated and is temporarily unemployed, and her other daughter, Battsetseg, age 22, studies at university. 

Densmaa has been working as a chef in a local state-owned company. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay her daughter's university tuition fee and dormitory fee. 

Densmaa is a hardworking, diligent and responsible woman.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fee and dormitory fee.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Hen is 43 years old and has three children. She is a villager from a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia, where rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. 

Hen supplements her income by growing onions and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She earns approximately 55,000 KHR per day from the current business, but she can manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day.

Hen has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five cycles and successfully paid back the loans, while her group co-member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Hen is leading the group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. 

As the leader, Hen is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy gasoline for water-pumping. She hopes to increase her income so as to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling selected used clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of selected clothing to sell in her used clothing business.

Helen has been in this business for 13 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of selected clothing to sell.

loans.name: Duger

texts.en:
Mr. Duger is 26 years old and lives with his parents in a ger (traditional Mongolian housing) in Uvs province of Mongolia. His parents are retired and stay home. 

Duger has been renting a vehicle and running a transportation service in town since 2010. He has gained a lot of experience and networks over the years. 

Duger is now starting his own taxi service business in town and requesting 4,700,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly car to provide a taxi service in town. He is a hardworking, honest and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly car to provide a taxi service in town.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in an auto/car repair shop with her husband for more than ten years now. This is the source of their income. Carina helps her husband in running their shop.

As of now, they need additional supplies for their shop, but lack the financial resources to have them. With this, Carina joined CEVI to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to entrepreneurs like her. 

With a loan, Carina will be able to buy materials for the auto shop, like spare wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, fluid, air compressors, batteries, lubricants and other items. With this, they will be able to improve their shop and cater to more customers, thus augmenting their earnings.

In the future, Carina hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials for the auto shop, like spare wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, fluid, air compressors, batteries, lubricants, and other items.

loans.name: Pedro Antony

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Pedro no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Industrial, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Pedro trabaja como obrero en una avícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea mejorar el techado y ponerle piso a su hogar, de esta manera el podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 20 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who is eager to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and because he had to work to help his parents, Pedro was unable to pursue a career in industrial engineering. 

In his spare time he enjoys watching movies and occasionally cooks a delicious Frejoles con Seco to share with his family. On his own initiative and with great effort and dedication, Pedro works as a laborer on a poultry farm in the city. He works about 10 hours every day and feels that things are going well because he does a good job and he treats others kindly. 

Pedro is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, due to their help, he will be able to make improvement to his house. He needs to repair the roof and install flooring and provide greater security and comfort for his family. To that end, he will continue to work and try to realize his dreams of becoming a professional someday.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.en: Urbana is 47 years old.  She is married and has five children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur.  She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 6,000PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She hopes and dreams to have a better future and to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité ´´La Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría de animal y la agricultura. Los fines de semanas organizan actividades como la venta de sopa paraguaya y fabrican almidón y venden en su comunidad para obtener fondo para el pago de las cuotas y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Marina, la presidenta solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados y animales para la venta, y así seguir trabajando para seguir dando a su familia lo que necesitan.
Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y su grupo está recibiendo pues les será de mucha ayuda para crecer.
texts.en:
The committee "La Esperanza" [The Hope] was formed through the union of several neighbors in the city of Santani. 

All of the members make a living raising animals and in agriculture. During weekends they organize activities such as selling "sopa paraguaya" [a traditional spongy cake similar to cornbread] and producing starch [similar to tapioca flour]. They sell the products in their community to obtain funds to make their payments and in this form help each other.

Marina, the president, is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of animal feed and animals to sell, and so continue working to continue giving her family all they need. She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her group are receiving since it will be very helpful for their growth.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and animals to sell

loans.name: Delia Fidela

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Delia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta tejer algunas prendas de vestir para sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Delia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras, adicionalmente trabaja en su pequeña parcela donde tiene algunos sembríos, Delia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Delia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar mayor cantidad  de verduras, como pepinillo, rocoto, lechuga, tubérculos y otros, de esta manera Delia tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos ya que desea verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Delia is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and two children, whom she loves and are the principal purpose of her life.

She is a very kind woman, hardworking and enthusiastic, who together with her husband dedicates all her efforts to get ahead. Unfortunately, because of limited economic resources and because she had to work since she was very young, Delia could not study a professional career. In her free time she likes to knit garments for her children and occasionally cook a delicious chicken and rice dish.

Through her own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Delia works in her small business selling vegetables. Additionally, she works on her small parcel of land where she has some sown fields. Delia works every day for about 10 hours and believes that things have been going well because she offers her customers good prices and kind treatment.

Delia is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since through their help she will be able to buy a larger quantity of vegetables, such as cucumber, peppers, lettuce, tubers and others, and in this way Delia will have a more well-stocked business and she will be able to attend to more customers. Thus she will continue working and making an effort to achieve her biggest dream of being able to provide a good education to her children, since she wishes to see them become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale such as cucumber, peppers, lettuce and tubers

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 52 years old.  She is married and has seven children. She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Marilou is borrowing PHP10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed for her chickens.  Marilou has been raising chickens for ten years and also earns additional income from selling rice .

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her chickens

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is 46 years old.  She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband is a worker. Oanh has been running a general store in front of her door for four years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Oanh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en: Mrs. Uyanga, 30 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her brother is raising her son at his home because she and her current husband have married recently and work day and night. She has been running mobile phone sales since 2005 and accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field of service. Her husband renders taxi service to local people by using his own automobile and during his free time, he helps her phone sales business. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to order a large quantity of mobile phones from Korea. Because only now, an opportunity has arisen for her to supply mobile phones to retail stalls which purchase phones at wholesale prices and sell them at retail prices. If she uses this opportunity of supply, she can generate more income for her family and can invest in her son’s future education. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who works day and night in order to create a bright future for her son.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones in large quantity from Korea

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 43 years old and has seven children. She is married and has four children in school. Helen is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Helen applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Helen has been farming sugarcane for 27 years, and she has borrowed from NWTF twice in the past to sustain her business. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her sugarcane farm.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling selected used clothing in the Philippines. Helen applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional used clothing to sell. Helen has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is widow and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Jocelyn applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional used clothing to sell. Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jocelyn  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en: Ma. Luna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa in the Philippines. Nipa are woven palm mats used for house repair and construction. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell. Ma. Luna has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from selling other construction materials. Ma. Luna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) to sell.

loans.name: Bach

texts.en: Bach, 43, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanic. Bach has been running a food stall for ten years, selling noodles and crab chowder. She is applying for a loan to expand her business by buying better quality food and ingredients, to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy crab, noodles and other ingredients to make chowder to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba works hard to support her family. Melba is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Melba requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, biscuits and other groceries needed in her business.  Melba has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Melba  would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, biscuits and other groceries needed in her business

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Sagrado Corazón de Jesús está en su ciclo 6, donde 4 de las mujeres mostraron en su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que estaban por debajo de la línea, es decir su ingreso es muy bajo.
Gricelda, una de las integrantes, está en el nivel de eliminación de pobreza 2. Y cuenta que por medio de su trabajo quiere poder mejorar su vida, y la de su familia, para poder ayudarlos y que no pasen por necesidades.  Ella vende frutas y verduras, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy buenos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y que así tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras y también de frutas, para seguir dando un buen producto a sus clientes y hacerse también de más clientela.
texts.en:
Sagrado Corazón de Jesús is in its sixth loan cycle. Four of the women in the group ranked below the poverty line according to the poverty elimination survey: that is they are very low-earners.

Gracelda, another of the members, self identifies at the poverty level [See information below]. She notes that through her work she wants to improve her own life and that of her family. She wants to be able to help her family so they don’t have to experience deprivation. She sells fruits and vegetables and says that she has many good customers because she always has very good products to offer them. Her business is providing her the means to help her family.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase vegetables and fruits so that she can continue to provide good produce and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Janeth Vannessa

texts.es:
Janneth es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a su familia, Janneth  no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Horno para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Janneth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, como cosméticos, cremas, perfumes y otros, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Janneth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una cisterna y la puesta de un tanque de agua en su vivienda, de esta manera Janneth podrá contar con un sistema que pueda brindarle agua en cualquier momento del día para ella y su familia, así pues Janneth seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Janneth,19, lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Ica, in the Parcona district. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who wishes hard to succeed. 

Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and because she has to work to support her family, Janneth has not been able to study Business Administration. 

In her free time she likes to watch TV and sometimes she cooks a delicious baked chicken to share with her family. 

By her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Janneth has a small business selling beauty products such as cosmetics, creams, perfumes etc. 

She works every day for approximately ten hours and believes she is doing well thanks to a variety in her products and the good service she provides her clients.  

Janneth is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help given she can build a cistern and water tank in her home. This way Janneth can count on a system that will bring her and her family water at any time of the day.

 Janneth will keep working and striving towards her big dream of being able to go to college.

loans.use: to build a cistern and water tank.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a 38 year-old married woman and a mother of four children, from Valencia, Bohol. She is engaged in a retail business selling dry goods like shirts, jeans, and other clothing materials, and cosmetics. Rosalie is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like clothing, cosmetics and other things.  With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income.  In the future, Rosalie hopes to make her business sustainable and successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like clothing, cosmetics and others

loans.name: Mungunzaya

texts.en: Mrs. Mungunzaya, 34 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar,  the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her husband has been working as a carpenter at a private business entity since 2012 and before this job, he was working in Korea on an employment contract from 2007 to 2012. She herself has been working as a beauty specialist for two years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this service field. Her two children both go to high school. The house the family lives in has been deteriorating over the past years since its construction in 1995 and needs some serious repairs and extensions.  She is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, bricks, planks and foams. Then the family can live in a comfortable and warm place and will burn less coal. This will contribute to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, bricks and planks

loans.name: Melly

texts.en: Melly is 59 years old.. She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school.  Melly  orks very hard to provide for them.  Melly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries, like sardines, noodles, eggs, spices, coffee, etc.  Melly has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Melly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries, like sardines, noodles, eggs, spices, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y su hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Cesar no pudo terminar sus estudios secundario y tampoco estudio una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear a caballo y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cesar se dedica a la agricultura, el trabaja en su pequeña parcela donde cultiva algodón, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Cesar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de mantenimiento, abono y riego de su cultivo, de esta manera Cesar podrá lograr que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente a fin de obtener una buena ganancia de su venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de adquirir ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 42-year-old man. He lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and son, both of whom he loves. They are the main purpose in his life. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, dedicates all his efforts toward moving his family forward. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work since he was very young, Cesar could not finish high school or study a professional major.

In his free time, he likes to ride horses, and sometimes he cooks some delicious spaghetti to share with his family. On his own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Cesar works in agriculture. He works on a small plot where he farms cotton. He works every day for approximately ten hours, and he believes things are going well because of his experience and the friendly way he treats others.

Cesar is very thankful for Kiva lenders, because with this help he will be able to cover his crop's maintenance, fertilizer and irrigation expenses. In this way, Cesar will be able to develop his crop adequately to obtain a good profit from his sale. He will continue working and trying to achieve his great dream of expanding his crops.

loans.use: to cover his crop's maintenance, fertilizer and irrigation expenses.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes runs a beauty salon in her place in Valencia, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children.  Lourdes works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for her beauty salon, like hair coloring, hair cream, and other salon essentials. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers in her salon, thus augmenting her income.  In the future, Lourdes hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her beauty salon, like hair coloring, hair cream, and other salon essentials

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo 12, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, teniendo un ingreso muy bajo por mes.
La Sra. Lilian  está en el nivel dos de la encuesta de eliminación, y con esfuerzo y el trabajo ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y de esa forma está saliendo adelante y tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Lilian solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, y asi surtirse para seguir dando a sus clientes buena variedad y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Emprendedoras [Women Entrepreneurs] is in its twelfth cycle. 

They are doing the poverty elimination survey. 

Two of them are below the poverty line and have a very low monthly income. 

Lilian is at level two of the elimination survey and with effort and work is improving her poverty situation. 

However she is aware that the work and effort she is doing needs to be continuous and permanent. 

She sells clothes and in this way is getting ahead. She has the means to help her family. 

Lilian is asking for this loan to invest it in buying all types of clothes. This way she can stock up and continue giving her clients good variety and continue growing.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jedus Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño Jesus está en su ciclo 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan  y se ayudan por salir adelante organizando actividades de manera grupal. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza y trabajan para salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos.
Natividad es parte de este grupo, ella está tratando de crecer y salir adelante, y se esfuerza por dar a su familia todo lo que puede. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, colchas frazadas, también se debe destacar el trabajo que ella hace por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Natividad solicita de este crédito para la compra de hamacas y colchas, para poder abastecer con lo que ella hace y asi seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que con ello podrá seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Divino Niño Jesus is in its 9th cycle of the program for groups of women, in which all of them work and help each other get ahead by organizing group activities. They are participating in the poverty elimination study, as 4 of them are below the poverty line and work to get ahead and increase their income.

Natividad is part of this group. She is trying to grow and get ahead, and she makes an effort ti give her family all that she can. She makes a living making hammocks, bedspreads and blankets. It should be mentioned that she does this work to move forward and help her family. 

Natividad is requesting this loan to buy hammocks and bedspreads, in order to supplement those that she makes and thus continue with her sales. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving, since with this help she will be able to continue growing and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy hammocks and bedspreads for sale

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang is requesting a new loan to buy a digital hair styler and hairdressing materials. Trang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family.  She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a digital hair styler and hairdressing materials

loans.name: Phi

texts.en: Phi would like to take a further loan to buy good quality foods to sell from her stall. Phi's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good quality foods to sell

loans.name: Khuong

texts.en: Khuong would like to take a further loan to buy a handcart and repair his motorcycle. Khuong's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a handcart and repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh, 43, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard. Trinh earns an income running a general store in front of her house.  She started this business 20 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of sanitary papers and electrical things to stock her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of sanitary papers and electrical things to sell

loans.name: José Tomás

texts.es:
José Tomás es un joven de 37 años, soltero, que estudió la carrera de Licenciatura en Español, originario de un caserío ubicado a 6 km del municipio de El Sauce.

 Actualmente se desempeña como profesor de secundaria impartiendo el área de español en la escuela de una comarca de dicho municipio donde tiene más de diez años de laborar.

Diario recorre en bicicleta la cual es su medio de transporte 10 km de su casa hasta la escuela para estar puntual en dicho centro.

Es un joven emprendedor que quiere cada día superarse y salir adelante en cuanto a su nivel académico, por eso está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le otorguen para el pago de un curso universitario que quiere realizar con el fin de actualizarse más en cuanto a su carrera.

Está seguro que con este financiamiento podrá pagar este curso que será de gran ayuda para su perfil profesional. Espera que estos inversionistas de buen corazón financien su solicitud donde quedará muy agradecido.
texts.en:
José Tomás is a young man who is 37 years old and single. He studied a Degree in Spanish at university. He is from a small community located 6km from El Sauce town.

At present he works as a secondary school teacher, giving Spanish classes in one of the local schools in the El Sauce area, where he has been working for over ten years.

Every day he cycles the 10 km from his home to the school. Bicycle is the mode of transport he uses to get to school on time.

He is an enterprising young man who wants to improve on a daily basis and get ahead academically. For this reason he is requesting a loan from the Kiva investors who, through Ceprodel, can grant the payment of a university course that he would like to complete. His purpose in doing the course is to develop his career.

He is sure that with this finance he will be able to pay for the course which will greatly benefit his professional profile. He hopes that the kind-hearted investors will respond to his request. He will be very grateful for their assistance.

loans.use: to pay for a university course

loans.name: La Amistad 2 Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso se han unido para trabajar juntas y con este trabajo en conjunto salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias. De allí surge el grupo llamado La Amistad 2, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de la pobreza.
Lidia es parte de este grupo, y cuenta que ella es limpiadora, y que también vende ropas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por salir adelante y es por eso que se está esforzando, ya que quiere mejorar su economía y también seguir ayudando a su familia.
La Sra. Lidia solicita de este crédito para la compra de remeras, pantalones y camisas para damas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eighteen women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso have joined together to work and jointly get ahead to help their families. 

This is where the group name La Amistad 2 [The Friendship 2] comes from. 

They are doing the poverty elimination survey and two of them are under the poverty line. 

Lidia is part of this group. She is a cleaner and also sells clothes. 

She is a hard working person who strives to get ahead. She is putting in effort because she wants to improve her economy and to get ahead helping her family. 

Lidia is asking for this loan to buy t-shirts, pants and blouses. This will help her solidify her business plan and in this way improve her income.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants and blouses.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 58, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her two daughters and  husband in Ho Chi Minh City.  Mai and her husband have been in business for forty years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

She also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is requesting a new loan to buy a turning lathe to increase the productive capacity of her metal shop. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new one will assist her in increasing both the size of her business and her income, and also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a turning lathe to increase productive capacity.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy mobile phones and mobile accessories for her son to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Loc

texts.en: Loc is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more motorcycle brakes from different suppliers to satisfy her customers. Loc's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycle brakes from different suppliers to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Nghia

texts.en: Nghia is requesting a new loan to buy a show-case and new furniture for his food stall to better serve his customers. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall and increasing sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a show-case and new furniture to better serve his customers.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong is requesting a new loan to expand her business by purchasing a wider range and larger quantity of beverages and coffees to stock in her store. Dong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a wider range and larger quantity of beverages and coffees to stock in her store.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
A 41-year-old married woman, Lourdes has been engaged in the business of making pots for more than ten years now. She lives with her family and two children in the town of Valencia, Bohol. Making pots is her way of earning a living.

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy more materials, such as clay, sand and cement, for making pots. With this loan, Lourdes will be able to make more pots, which will allow her to sell more to the market. In the future, Lourdes hopes of making her business a success and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more materials, such as clay, sand and cement, for making pots.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Luis vive en Playas, el tiene 27 años de edad. El empezó aproximadamente hace 5 años, con la liquidación de su trabajo decidió establecer su propio negocio, poco a poco creció hasta llegar a tener a tener su local de venta de batidos y jugos.

El se levanta a las 6:00 de la mañana, sale al mercado a comprar frutas frescas para brindar un producto de primera calidad a sus clientes.

La dificultad que se le presenta un poco en su trabajo es la delincuencia, pero la policía está realizando operativos  con más frecuencia por su negocio. El es soltero, y no tiene hijos. 

Con el préstamo el va a comprar frutas, una licuadora, una vitrina para vender sus jugos. El desea para el futuro poder comprar material de construcción. Cemento, hierro y arena para seguir avanzando con la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis, age 27, lives in Playas.  He started approximately five years ago.  With the severance pay from his work he decided to establish his own business.  It grew little by little until he came to have a place selling juice and smoothies.

He gets up at 6:00 a.m. and leaves to buy fresh fruit at the market.  He does this in order to offer his customers a first quality product.

The difficulty that is a bit present in his work is the crime.  However, the police are more frequently conducting operations around his business.

He is single and does not have children.

He will use the loan to buy fruit, a blender, and a display case in order to sell his juices. 

In the future he wishes to be able to buy construction materials like cement, iron, and sand in order to continue progressing with the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, a blender, and a display case for his business.

loans.name: Truc

texts.en: Truc is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients and food to sell from her stall. Truc's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and food to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes for resale to continue earning her living

loans.name: Shirzana

texts.en:
Shirzana, 38, lives with her husband and four children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family came to Darkhan city in 2001 from Selenge province, located in the northern part of Mongolia. In Darkhan, she and her husband found jobs quickly and purchased an apartment, and also owned their part of the land from the state. 

Shirzana has been working as a nurse at hospital since 1998, and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in the nursing field. Her husband has been rendering taxi service to local people within Darkhan city since 2001, using his own automobile. Their elder daughter and son both go to high school and a younger son and six-month-old baby stay at home. 

Shirzana is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase planks for building fences around her land. By building fences, it signifies the land has its own landowner to outsiders and also protects vegetables and grass from domestic animals. Shirzana is a very hardworking individual who wants to build her summer house on her land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase planks which will be used for building fences.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang is requesting a new loan to buy coffee and beverages to sell at her shop.  Trang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that with the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em would like to take another loan to buy a greater quantity of beverages to sell from her stall. Em's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and
increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu is requesting a new loan to buy sewing materials to increase her sales. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials to increase her sales.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Dieu would like to take another loan to buy rice and food to to sell from her stall. Dieu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice and food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Kaze Group

texts.fr:
Lazard fait partie du groupe Kaze  et est un des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Il est client de Turame depuis   3ans. Il  habite à  Bujumbura. Il est marié à Grâce. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants  âgés de 15 à 30 ans, dont 4 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 4 enfants:1 orphelin et 3 enfants membres de sa famille élargie.

Il faisait le commerce des  habits  au marché central de Bujumbura. Il a perdu  tout son capital alors qu’il avait un projet de construction de maison.

Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des  habits   à revendre, pour  gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Lazard is part of the group Kaze and is one of the victims of the fire at the Bujumbura Central Market. He has been a client of Turame for three years. He lives in Bujumbura and is married to Grâce. Together they have seven children, from 15 to 30 years old, of whom four are students.

He used to do commerce in clothing at the Bujumbura Central Market. In the fire, he lost all of his capital when he had plans to build a house. 

With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he will rebuild his capital by purchasing clothing to resell, so as to earn his living.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell, so as to earn his living

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale to earn his living

loans.name: Doris Hermelinda

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida,  ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Doris no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Doris trabaja en su pequeño kiosko, donde vende desayunos y otros alimentos, ella trabaja en un centro educativo de su ciudad, donde le alquilan un pequeño espacio para que brinde sus servicios, Doris trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Doris se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, como golosinas, gaseosas, agua mineral y otros, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Doris is a 33 year old woman who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her two children whom she loves very much and who are her reason for living. She is a very friendly person, hardworking and enthusiastic. She dedicates all her effort to helping her family get ahead, since she is both mother and father to her children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, and because she needed to work from the time she was very young, Doris wasn’t able to study a professional career. She would have liked very much to do so. In her free time she likes to watch television, and on occasion she likes to cook a delicious rice with chicken to share with her family.

By her own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Doris works in her small kiosk where she sells breakfasts and other foods. She works at a school in her city, where she rents a small space to provide her services. Doris works every day for approximately 10 hours and she thinks things have gone well for her because of the friendly treatment she provides her customers. 

Doris is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since it is through their help that she will be able to buy the merchandise she needs to stock her business, such as sweets, soft drinks, mineral water, and other things. This way she will continue working hard to achieve her dream of having a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Merineza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Merineza works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear. Merineza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell.

Merineza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 34 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for two years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en: Chanda is 21 years old. She is a third year university student who lives with her parents in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. She is the third daughter in the family. She graduated from high school in 2011. After that, she pursued her studies in the university, majoring in Accounting. She is a very hardworking and smart student. For the first and second year, she received support from her parents for her study. Since she has an extensive family which contains seven members, her parents cannot provide enough support for their children. Therefore, Chanda requests a loan of $1000 to pay for her university tuition fee. This money will help her obtain enough ability to finish her bachelor degree. In the future, she hopes to get a good job and be employed as an accountant in a company or organization in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fee

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda, a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for 19 years, earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo 2, donde todas ellas se unieron con para poder salir adelante y crecer. Son 13 mujeres muy trabajadoras, que quieren ayudar a sus familias y dar a sus familias todo lo que ellos necesitan.
La Sra. Blanca es una de las integrantes, ella es de una  de las colonias de la ciudad de Caaguazú, donde tiene su pequeño negocio de gomeria. Desea que con el tiempo, y por medio de su trabajo pueda ir creciendo y mejorando su negocio y su estilo de vida, para poder ser una gran microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su gomeria, ya que eso le ayudará a seguir dando a su clientela un buen servicio y poder cumplir con pedidos.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas [United Women] is in its second phase.  They all joined together in order to get ahead and grow. 

They are thirteen very hard working women how want to help their families and give them everything they need. 

Blanca is one of the members. She is from one of the residential districts in the city of Caaguazú where she has her small auto repair shop. 

She hopes that with time and through her work, she can grow and improve her business and her lifestyle in order to become a great small business owner. 

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for the auto repair shop. 

This will help her to keep giving her clientele good service and keep up with her orders.

loans.use: to buy supplies for an auto repair shop.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more nipa to sell for her business buying and selling nipa.

Mirasol has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from fishing.

Mirasol has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to sell

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesús está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, todas ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente están conscientes de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente.
La Sra. Raimunda hace trabajos de costura, arreglos de prendas de vestir, elaboración y venta de todo tipo de prendas. Ella cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace pedidos y con ellos está creciendo como microempresaria, ya que son sus mismos clientes lo que le hacen publicidad.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Tejidos, Telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros insumos, ya que tiene pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
The group called "Divino Niño Jesús" is in its fifth loan cycle with the women's communal bank, where they all work and help one another to succeed. Through effort and working continually, all are lifting themselves out of poverty. But at the same time, they are aware that this work and effort must be on-going and permanent.

Raimunda does sewing work, mending of clothing, and makes and sells all types of clothing articles. She says that she has a very good clientele, who always place orders with her. With these, she is growing as a small businessperson, as her customers are her best advertising.

She is requesting this loan to buy material, fabric, thread, needles and other supplies, as she has orders and would like to be able to fill them.

loans.use: To buy material, fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus es un hombre de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, Jesus no pudo terminar su carrera profesional para convertirse en Profesor de Matemáticas, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jesus trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra arroz y en la que trabaja realizando labores de campo, Jesus trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jesus se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento general y la compra de llantas nuevas para su mototaxi, de esta manera Jesus tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejore condiciones y podrá atender a mas pasajeros, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran tienda de abarrotes donde pueda trabajar con su esposa.
texts.en:
Jesus is a man of 41. He lives in the city of Chiclayo, in the Guadalupe district, with his wife and their two children whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person, who with his wife devotes all his efforts to helping their family get ahead in life. 

Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources, and because he needed to work, Jesus was not able to finish his professional degree so that he could become a math teacher. In his free time he likes to cook a very delicious ceviche to share with his family.

Through his own initiative, and with a great deal of effort and dedication, Jesus works as a mototaxi driver, providing transportation services in his city. Additionally he has a small parcel of land where he grows rice and where he does farm work. Jesus works every day for approximately 10 hours, and thinks it is going well due to how responsible he is, and the friendly way he treats other people.

Jesus is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided, he will be able to carry out general maintenance and buy new tires for his    mototaxi. In this way Jesus will have his work vehicle in better condition and be able to serve more passengers. He will continue working and doing his best to achieve his great dream of having a large grocery store where can work with his wife.

loans.use: To maintain his mototaxi.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es de la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante, se dedica a la confección de sábanas, fundas y otras prendas de vestir, también es maestra y enseña a alumnos en forma particular desde horas de la tarde. Es soltera sin hijos vive en casa propia con sus padres.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, hace 5 años que se dedica a las ventas, por lo que ya es muy conocida y ya tiene una clientela bien formada.
Solicita el crédito por segunda vez para invertir en su negocio y seguir trabajando, quiere comprar prendas para la venta, ya que se acerca el frío y quiere poder tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Celia is from the city of Pilar.  She has a small business selling sheets, pillowcases and articles of clothing. She is also a teacher and gives private classes in the afternoon. She is single, with no children, and lives in her own house with her parents.

She is very hard-working person. She has been selling for five years, so she is already very well-known and has a well-established clientele. 

She is applying for her second loan so that she can invest in her business and continue working. She wants to buy articles of clothing to sell, as the cold season is approaching and she wants to have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Margarita es de la ciudad de Concepción en donde tiene su negocio, ella es costurera y confecciona uniformes escolares en donde cuenta con clientes en varias partes de la ciudad. También cuenta con ventas de ropas, mercería, calzados, comestibles, entre otros, su local es concurrido en la Ciudad ya que se encuentra en un lugar bien ubicado y tiene buena clientela.
La Sra. Margarita desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de su esfuerzo  pueda ir mejorando su negocio  y así ofrecer una vida digna a su familia y poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas y confeccionar  los uniformes. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in the city of Concepción, where she has her business. She is a seamstress and makes school uniforms. She has customers in several parts of the city. She also sells clothing, sewing supplies, footwear, groceries and other items. Her shop in the city is busy, as it is well located and has a good clientele. 

Margarita wishes, as time goes on, and through her effort, to be able to gradually improve her business. This way she can offer a decent life to her family and be able to secure a better future for them.

She is applying for this loan to buy fabric and to make uniforms, enabling her to continue seeing her business grow and to give her family what they need to have a life without hardships.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making uniforms.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 55 years old and married with nine children.

Ninfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Ninfa has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling nipa for 32 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Ninfa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body for a rickshaw transport business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jose Nestor

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 68 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa, tiene 6 hijos ya mayores, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa han dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jose no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jose trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de plásticos, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y realiza sus ventas en una pequeña balsa, la cual le ayuda a transportarse pequeños pueblos cercanos a su hogar, Jose cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar madera, calaminas, clavos y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder construir la fechada de su vivienda, de esta manera él podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues Jose seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda trabajar con su esposa.
texts.en:
José is a man of 68, and lives with his wife in the city of Pucallpa. He has six children, now adults, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living.  He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who with his wife has dedicated all his efforts to helping his family get ahead in life. 

Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and because he needed to work from young age, José was not able to study to be a professional auto mechanic. In his free time he likes to cook a very delicious "Ají de Gallina," (traditional Peruvian dish, made with aji peppers, chicken, and a cream sauce) to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and with great deal of effort and dedication, José works in his small business selling plastic items. He works every day for approximately 10 hours, and carries on his sales using a small boat, which helps him to travel to small towns near his home. José believes that it is going well because of the good prices and the friendly way he serves his customers.

José is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to do improvements to his home. He wishes to buy wood, sheet metal roofing, nails, and other supplies that will be a great help to him in building onto the front part of his house. In this way he will be able to offer greater safety and well-being to his family.
