All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Jairo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jairo se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene un pequeño cultivo de cacao, en donde realiza diversas labores de campo, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad  y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jairo se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del mantenimiento, abono y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Jairo podrá lograr que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente y logre una buena venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Jairo is 22 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  He is very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic and has a strong desire to move ahead in life.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and because he needed to find work to support his parents, Jairo was not able to study medicine as he had wanted.  In his spare time he likes to prepare a delicious "Seco de Res" (a traditional, Peruvian beef stew) to share with his family.

Under his own initiative and with a lot of dedication and determination, Jairo makes a living in agriculture and has a small cocoa plantation where he carries out various jobs.  He works every day for around ten hours and he thinks it is going well because he is responsible and because he treats others well.

Jairo is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support provided, he will be able to cover the costs of maintaining, fertilising and harvesting his crop.  As a result Jairo's crops will grow properly and he will have good sales.  This will then allow him to continue working and putting in the effort to achieve his dream of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to cover the costs of maintaining, fertilising and harvesting his crops.

loans.name: Yisel Isabel

texts.es: Desde al año 2010 Yisel decidió emprender una actividad con la cual generar ingresos para respaldar los gastos de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 2 años y 6 meses de nacido. Así fue como ahorró un poco de su presupuesto famliar y apoyada por su cónyuge compró los primeros articulos como collares, calzado  y perfumería, que vendió por su propia cuenta y le fue muy bien. Posteriormente compró su primera vitrina y paso a paso se fue involucrando en el mercado, hasta que accedió a afiliarse a una empresa que ofrece, mediante guias especializadas de productos, diversidad de mercancias. Su negocio hoy  ha crecido porque maneja ventas a credito y de contado, pero muchas veces y en especial en temporadas donde las ventas se incrmentan, su capital no es suficiente para respodner a la demanda y esto es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financimaineto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de bisuteríaque venderá entre su clientela mas rentable, porque su sueño es finamente tener un local comecial bien surtido donde su clientela encuentre todo lo que necesita y desea.
texts.en:
Since 2010, Yisel decided to undertake an activity in which she could generate an income to help support her household's spending, her family is made up of her partner and their two children aged 2 years and 6 months respectively. As such, she saved a little of the family budget and, supported by her partner, she bought her first items such as necklaces, shoes and perfume which she sells by herself, and it is going very well.

She then bought her first glass cabinet and little by little she made her mark in the market, to the point of partnering with a business which offers a wide range of products via specialized product guides. Her business today has grown because she sells by credit and on a cash basis, however, on several occasions, particularly in seasons where sales rise, her working capital is insufficient to meet demand and this is precisely why she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first type of financing from the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. With this loan, she will buy jewelry products and will sell to her more well-off customers, all of this because her dream is to finally have a well-stocked commercial store where her customers find all they need.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: 03.08.06- Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Chung is 41 years old and she is married and has two children. Chung lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Chung operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. Chung has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Chung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2011, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chung has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Chung is the group leader of the 03.08.06-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Chung hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Kaycee

texts.en:
Kaycee is 25 and single. She's currently residing at the village of Villa Luna together with her parents. 

She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost five years. In this business she's earning an income of PHP 3,000 a month. 

She would like a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, and beverages.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Age 30 and a mother of one son, Pov is a local citizen from Kampong Cham province. She struggles against her family’s hardships via rice farming and her husband helps to supplement the family’s income via working at rubber plantation, tapping rubber trees for latex. The current business which she has been with for 10 years, generates about 18,300 KHR per day.

 Pov is a four-cycle client with VisionFund (Cambodia) and has repaid her past loans successfully. This has enabled her to increase her income and keep her children in school. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. She and her joint borrower are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. She is the group leader and she will use her loan to pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings. She hopes to grow her crops in a timely manner and earn more income.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en Morazan, Yoro.
Don Pedro hace 10 años su fuente ingresos es un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado. Inicio este negocio con fondos propios y con la necesidad de generar sus propios ingreso. El hace de manera ambulante su venta y ademas trabaja por pedidos, mantiene ya sus propios cliente y dice que le ha ido bien, ya que ha podido tener los ingresos para mantener a su familia. Tambien esta muy contento con la ayuda que ha recibido con los financiamientos que le han permitido mantener su negocio estable.
El esta solicitando actualmente su catorceavo prestamo de 6,000 lempiras para comprar ropa de verano y aprovechar la temporada veraniega.
la meta que el tiene es seguir atendiendo sus clientes con los pedidos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 56 years old, he is married, has one child and lives in Morazan, Yoro. For the last ten years, Pedro's source of income comes from selling clothes and footwear. He is a travelling salesman, and also works by orders. He already has his own customers and says that it is going well as he has been able to secure an income to support his family. He is also very happy with the help he has received with the loans that have enabled him to keep his business going steady.

He is currently seeking his 14th loan of 6,000 Honduran Lempiras to buy summer clothing and make the most of the summer season. Pedro's goal is to continue meeting customer orders.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Geiter

texts.es:
Geiter, de 56 años de edad, esta divorciado de la madre de sus hijos y actualmente vive solo en un cuarto alquilado, pero mensualmente pasa la pensión para sus hijos menores.
Geiter se dedica a transportar pasajeros en la ciudad, para eso cuenta con un vehículo conocido como mototaxi, siendo su herramienta de trabajo y fuente de sustento.  Le gusta su trabajo  y decidió iniciarse hace más de 8  años, porque perdió su empleo en una compañía, necesitando una fuente de ingreso económico, se decidió por éste oficio. Le gusta  su actividad pues le permite tener ingresos económicos sustanciales para pagar los gastos propios de su hogar y darse una mejor calidad de vida..
Geiter espera seguir creciendo, ya que esta actividad  siempre tiene demanda, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio.Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva y se siente contento de contar con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso asegura será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 nuevo soles comprará repuestos para su mototaxi, y así mantener en buen estado a su vehículo.
texts.en:
Geiter is 56 years old, is divorced from the mother of his children, and currently lives alone in a rented room. He pays for his younger children's board on a monthly basis.

Geiter makes a living transporting passengers around the city. To do this, he uses a vehicle known as a motorcycle-taxi, his work tool and source of livelihood. He enjoys his job, and chose this profession over eight years ago after losing his job with a company and needing a source of income. He likes his work because it allows him to earn enough to pay his living expenses and give himself a better quality of life.

Geiter hopes to continue growing, since there is always a demand for this activity, which is why he plans to expand his business. This is his third loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for the financial support given to help him succeed with his business. For this reason, he promises to make his loan repayments on time. He will use the loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle-taxi, in order to keep it in good working order.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a motorcycle-taxi.
